Resources

Hub of Hope

Hub of Hope's core purpose is to connect people with relevant support options, from crisis and urgent help services to ongoing peer, community, and specialist provision. The directory lists tens of thousands of services, and organisations can register their details so the database stays current and comprehensive. This makes it useful both for people seeking immediate help and for those looking for longer-term or specialist support.

visit Hub of Hope

Mental Health Foundation

The Mental Health Foundation is the UK’s leading charity focused on helping people understand, protect, and sustain their mental wellbeing. Since 1949, it has championed prevention, research, and community programs that tackle the root causes of mental health challenges. By promoting awareness and practical solutions, the Foundation works to create a world where good mental health is a reality for all.

Visit the Mental Health Foundation

NHS England services and resources

NHS England provides a wide range of mental health resources designed to support people of all ages. With a focus on prevention, early intervention, and equal access to care, the NHS offers services such as Talking Therapies for anxiety and depression, community programs for children and young people, and guidance for managing everyday wellbeing. These resources aim to put mental health on the same footing as physical health, ensuring everyone can find the help they need when they need itThe Mental Health Foundation is the UK’s leading charity focused on helping people understand, protect, and sustain their mental wellbeing.

Mind (charity)

Mind is a leading mental health charity in England and Wales, dedicated to ensuring that no one faces a mental health problem alone. Through advice, information, and local support services, Mind empowers people to understand and manage their mental wellbeing. The charity also campaigns for better mental health policy and works to challenge stigma, striving to create a society where everyone gets the respect and support they deserve.

Visit Mind
